means: 用头顶（球）( head的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He took off at once and headed back to the motel.
sentence.Network_cn: 他立刻离开，回到汽车旅馆。

sentence.Network_en: Kevin was always level-headed with both feet on the ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 凯文总是头脑冷静，脚踏实地。

sentence.Network_en: Ninety per cent of lone parent families are headed by mothers.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表A ... honeymoon n. 蜜月 headed adj. 有头的, 有标题的 need n. 需要, 必需, 必需品, 要求, 贫困.
《Friends》词汇表A ... honeymoon n. 蜜月 headed adj. 有头的, 有标题的 need n. 需要, 必需, 必需品, 要求, 贫困.
He joined an organization headed by Lord Berry ., 他加入了一个以贝里勋爵为首的组织.

Chirac founded the neo-Gaullist Rally for the Republic party , today transformed into the Union for a Popular Movement , or UMP , that Sarkozy headed before being elected president on May6 .他成立的共和党“新戴高乐主义”同盟将为萨科奇在5月6日当选总统前所领导的“人民运动联盟”取代。

...学习的自由度，以适应信息社会、全球化和终生学习的需要。在实施素质教育方面，可用“4个H“来概括，即“头（head）“，“心（heart）“，“手（hand“，“健康（health）“。所谓头，即强调培养大学生的精神.

entry.def: Your head is the top part of your body, which has your eyes, mouth, and brain in it.

example.ex: She turned her head away from him...
example.tran: 她把头别过去，不再看他。

example.ex: He took a puff on his pipe and shook his head.
example.tran: 他抽了口烟斗，摇了摇头。

entry.def: You can use head to refer to your mind and your mental abilities.

example.ex: I can't get that song out of my head.
example.tran: 那首歌在我脑海中挥之不去。

example.ex: ...an exceptional analyst who could do complex maths in his head.
example.tran: 会心算复杂数学题的杰出分析家

entry.tran: （队伍中的）领头位置;队首;排头
entry.def: The head of a line of people or vehicles is the front of it, or the first person or vehicle in the line.

example.ex: ...the head of the queue...
example.tran: 队首

example.ex: We took our place at the head of the convoy.
example.tran: 我们排在护送队伍的最前面。

entry.def: If someone or something heads a line or procession, they are at the front of it.

example.ex: The parson, heading the procession, had just turned right towards the churchyard.
example.tran: 走在行进队伍最前面的教区牧师刚刚向右转弯，朝着教堂墓地走去。

entry.def: If something heads a list or group, it is at the top of it.

example.ex: Running a business heads the list of ambitions among the 1,000 people interviewed by Good Housekeeping magazine.
example.tran: 在《好管家》杂志采访过的1,000人中，创立自己的公司在理想抱负中列在首位。

entry.def: The head of something is the highest or top part of it.

example.ex: ...the head of the stairs...
example.tran: 楼梯的顶部

example.ex: Every day a different name was placed at the head of the chart.
example.tran: 每天都有一个不同的名字被列在这张表的最上端。

entry.def: The head of something long and thin is the end which is wider than or a different shape from the rest, and which is often considered to be the most important part.

example.ex: There should be no exposed screw heads...
example.tran: 螺钉顶端不应该外露。

example.ex: Keep the head of the club the same height throughout the swing.
example.tran: 整个挥杆过程中要使杆头始终保持在同一高度。

entry.def: The head of a school is the teacher who is in charge.

example.ex: She is full of admiration for the head and teachers.
example.tran: 她对校长和教师们满心钦佩。

entry.tran: （公司、组织的）负责人，领导人，首脑，长，主任
entry.def: The head of a company or organization is the person in charge of it and in charge of the people in it.

example.ex: Heads of government from more than 100 countries gather in Geneva tomorrow.
example.tran: 来自100多个国家的政府首脑明日将齐聚日内瓦。

example.ex: ...the head waiter.
example.tran: 侍者领班

entry.def: If you head a department, company, or organization, you are the person in charge of it.

example.ex: ...Michael Williams, who heads the department's Office of Civil Rights.
example.tran: 负责该部民权处的迈克尔·威廉斯

example.ex: ...the ruling Socialist Party, headed by Dr Franz Vranitzky.
example.tran: 由弗朗兹·弗拉尼兹基博士领导的执政社会党

entry.def: The head of an infected spot is its white or yellow centre.
The head on a glass of beer is the layer of small bubbles that form on the top of the beer.
You can use head to say how many animals of a particular type a farmer has. For example, if they have fifty head of cattle, they have fifty cows.
If you have a bad head, you have a headache.

example.ex: I had a terrible head and was extraordinarily drunk.
example.tran: 我头很痛，已经酩酊大醉。

entry.tran: （硬币的）有人头像的一面，正面
entry.def: If you toss a coin and it comes down heads, you can see the side of the coin which has a picture of a head on it.

example.ex: 'We might toss up for it,' suggested Ted. 'If it's heads, then we'll talk.'...
example.tran: “我们可以掷硬币来决定。”特德建议道，“如果是正面，我们就谈谈。”

example.ex: Heads or tails?
example.tran: 你猜是正面还是反面？

entry.tran: 朝着（某一地点）行进（美国英语中亦作 are headed）
entry.def: If you are heading for a particular place, you are going towards that place. In American English, you can also say that you are headed for a particular place.

example.ex: He headed for the bus stop...
example.tran: 他朝着公共汽车站走去。

example.ex: ...an Iraqi vessel heading for the port of Basra...
example.tran: 开往巴士拉港的一艘伊拉克船

entry.tran: 很可能要遭受，会招致（美国英语中亦作 is headed for）
entry.def: If something or someone is heading for a particular result, the situation they are in is developing in a way that makes that result very likely. In American English, you can also say that something or someone is headed for a particular result.

example.ex: The latest talks aimed at ending the civil war appear to be heading for deadlock...
example.tran: 为结束内战而进行的最新谈判好像要陷入僵局。

example.ex: He said anyone giving orders without respecting the wishes of his people is heading for disaster...
example.tran: 他说任何不尊重人民意愿而发号施令的人都注定会走向灭亡。

entry.def: If a piece of writing is headed a particular title, it has that title written at the beginning of it.

example.ex: One chapter is headed, 'Beating the Test'.
example.tran: 有一章的标题为“战胜考试”。

entry.def: If you head a ball in football, you hit it with your head in order to make it go in a particular direction.

example.ex: He headed the ball across the face of the goal.
example.tran: 他一个头球，球从球门前横飞而过。

entry.def: You use a head or per head after stating a cost or amount in order to indicate that that cost or amount is for each person in a particular group.

example.ex: This simple chicken dish costs less than £1 a head...
example.tran: 这道简单的鸡肉菜肴每人的花费还不到1英镑。

example.ex: Ethiopia, for instance uses the equivalent of just twenty kilos of oil per head a year.
example.tran: 比如说，埃塞俄比亚每年的人均消费支出仅相当于20公斤的石油。

entry.def: If something or someone does your head in, they make you angry or frustrated.

example.ex: Living with my parents is doing my head in.
example.tran: 和父母住在一起让我很沮丧。

entry.def: From head to foot means all over your body.

example.ex: Colin had been put into a bath and been scrubbed from head to foot.
example.tran: 科林被放进浴缸，从头到脚仔仔细细洗了个干净。

entry.def: If you have a head for something, you can deal with it easily. For example, if you have a head for figures, you can do arithmetic easily, and if you have a head for heights, you can climb to a great height without feeling afraid.

example.ex: I don't have a head for business.
example.tran: 我没有生意头脑。

example.ex: ...an extraordinarily effective organiser with a remarkable head for figures.
example.tran: 很有算术头脑、工作效率极高的组织者

entry.tran: 充分理解并接受;打定（主意）
entry.def: If you get a fact or idea into your head, you suddenly realize or think that it is true and you usually do not change your opinion about it.

example.ex: Once they get an idea into their heads, they never give up.
example.tran: 一旦接受了一个想法，他们就永远不会放弃。

entry.def: If you say that someone has got something into their head, you mean that they have finally understood or accepted it, and you are usually criticizing them because it has taken them a long time to do this.

example.ex: Managers have at last got it into their heads that they can no longer accept inefficient operations.
example.tran: 管理者们终于意识到自己不能再安于低效率的运营了。

entry.tran: 让…自由行动;对…不加约束
entry.def: If you give someone their head, you allow them to do what they want to do, without trying to advise or stop them.

example.ex: He recognised ability and gave people their heads.
example.tran: 他发现别人的才能，并且让他们自由发挥。

entry.def: If alcoholic drink goes to your head, it makes you feel drunk.

example.ex: That wine was strong, it went to your head.
example.tran: 那酒劲儿很大，喝了会上头。

entry.tran: （赞扬或成功）冲昏…的头脑，使…骄傲自满
entry.def: If you say that something such as praise or success goes to someone's head, you are criticizing them because you think that it makes them too proud or confident.

example.ex: Ford is definitely not a man to let a little success go to his head.
example.tran: 福特绝对不是那种会被一点点成功冲昏头脑的人。

entry.def: If you are head over heels or head over heels in love, you are very much in love.

example.ex: I was very attracted to men and fell head over heels many times.
example.tran: 我很容易被男性吸引，曾多次深陷情网。

entry.def: If you keep your head, you remain calm in a difficult situation. If you lose your head, you panic or do not remain calm in a difficult situation.

example.ex: She was able to keep her head and not panic...
example.tran: 她设法保持镇静，没有陷入恐慌。

example.ex: She lost her head and started screaming at me.
example.tran: 她惊慌失措，开始向我大声尖叫。

entry.def: If you knock something on the head, you stop it.

example.ex: When we stop enjoying ourselves we'll knock it on the head.
example.tran: 等玩够了，我们就会结束。

entry.def: Phrases such as laugh your head off and scream your head off can be used to emphasize that someone is laughing or screaming a lot or very loudly.

example.ex: He carried on telling a joke, laughing his head off.
example.tran: 他继续讲笑话，自己笑得前仰后合。

entry.tran: （吸毒后）昏头昏脑的，神志不清的
entry.def: If you say that someone is off their head, you mean that they have taken so many drugs that they do not know what they are doing.
If you say that someone is off their head, you think that their ideas or behaviour are very strange, foolish, or dangerous.

example.ex: He's gone completely off his head.
example.tran: 他已经完全昏了头了。

entry.tran: 倒过来想;从全新的角度理解
entry.def: If you stand an idea or argument on its head or turn it on its head, you think about it or treat it in a completely new and different way.

example.ex: Their relationship turned the standard notion of marriage on its head.
example.tran: 他们的关系完全颠覆了传统的婚姻观念。

entry.def: If something such as an idea, joke, or comment goes over someone's head, it is too difficult for them to understand.

example.ex: I admit that a lot of the ideas went way over my head.
example.tran: 我承认那些想法中有很多远远超出了我的理解力。

entry.def: If someone does something over another person's head, they do it without asking them or discussing it with them, especially when they should do so because the other person is in a position of authority.

example.ex: He was reprimanded for trying to go over the heads of senior officers.
example.tran: 他因试图越过高层官员自作主张而受到斥责。

entry.tran: （不好的事情）再次出现，重新抬头
entry.def: If you say that something unpleasant or embarrassing rears its ugly head or raises its ugly head, you mean that it occurs, often after not occurring for some time.

example.ex: There was a problem which reared its ugly head about a week after she moved back in...
example.tran: 她搬回来大约一周之后，一个问题又重新出现了。

example.ex: The scourge of racial tyranny should never again be allowed to raise its ugly head.
example.tran: 永远不能让种族主义暴政的祸患重新抬头。

entry.def: If you stand on your head, you balance upside down with the top of your head and your hands on the ground.
If you say that you cannot make head nor tail of something or you cannot make head or tail of it, you are emphasizing that you cannot understand it at all.

example.ex: I couldn't make head nor tail of the damn film.
example.tran: 这部该死的影片我一点儿都看不懂。

entry.tran: 突然决定（做某事，尤指古怪或愚蠢的事）；心血来潮
entry.def: If somebody takes it into their head to do something, especially something strange or foolish, they suddenly decide to do it.

example.ex: He suddenly took it into his head to go out to Australia to stay with his son.
example.tran: 他突然心血来潮，打算去澳大利亚和儿子一起住。

entry.tran: 到了危急关头;到达关键点
entry.def: If a problem or disagreement comes to a head or is brought to a head, it becomes so bad that something must be done about it.

example.ex: These problems came to a head in September when five of the station's journalists were sacked.
example.tran: 这些问题在9月变得十分尖锐，当时该台有5名记者遭到辞退。

entry.def: If you bang peoples' heads together or knock their heads together, you tell them off severely for doing something wrong or for not doing something they were asked to do.

example.ex: It is now high time he banged his colleagues' heads together.
example.tran: 现在该是他敲打敲打同事们的时候了。

entry.def: If two or more people put their heads together, they talk about a problem they have and try to solve it.

example.ex: So everyone put their heads together and eventually an amicable arrangement was reached.
example.tran: 因此大家集思广益，最终作出了妥善的安排。

entry.tran: （尤指在生意方面）勉强逃脱困境
entry.def: If you keep your head above water, you just avoid getting into difficulties; used especially to talk about business.

example.ex: We are keeping our head above water, but our cash flow position is not too good.
example.tran: 我们正努力避免陷入困境，但我们的现金流动情况不太好。

entry.tran: 有人会遭殃，有人会（因此）受到惩罚（尤指被解雇）
entry.def: If you say that heads will roll as a result of something bad that has happened, you mean that people will be punished for it, especially by losing their jobs.

example.ex: The group's problems have led to speculation that heads will roll.
example.tran: 已经有人猜测，该集团的问题会导致一些人被解雇。

means.word_mean: 1. having a heading or course in a certain direction;
3. having a head or anything that serves as a head; often used in combination;
4. of leafy vegetables; having formed into a head;

auth_sentence.content: Or could we enjoy a more clear-headed old age?
auth_sentence.res_content: Or could we enjoy a more clear-headed old age?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or could we enjoy a more clear-headed old age?

auth_sentence.content: But, that's exactly where we're headed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But, that's exactly where we're headed.

auth_sentence.content: Today, the Voyagers are headed into the void.
auth_sentence.res_content: Today, the Voyagers are headed into the void.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Today, the Voyagers are headed into the void.

Sentence.sentence: To achieve a desired vision for your business, it is vital that you have a personal vision of where you are headed and what you value.
